snippet: The comments by the deputy prime minister, Bulent Arinc, followed days of intensifying street violence and signs of a broadening government crackdown.
abstract: Turkey's deputy prime minister, Bulent Arinc, raises possibility that country's army could be called in to help quell continuing civil unrest; comments are seen as latest sign of broadening government crackdown against nearly three-week-old protest movement.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and SEBNEM ARSU

lead_paragraph: The comments by the deputy prime minister, Bulent Arinc, followed days of intensifying street violence and signs of a broadening government crackdown.

headline.main: Turkish Official Says Army May Have to End Protests
headline.print_headline: Turkish Official Says Army May Have to End Protests
